intro: Diascia sacculata, commonly known as the basket flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual or perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Diascia sacculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
